meanings.definition: To make a short, sharp, explosive sound.
meanings.sent2: I popped the bubble with my finger.
meanings.sent3: The popcorn popped in the microwave.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement popped like a balloon.
meanings.sent5: The firecracker popped in the night sky.

meanings.sent1: The cat popped out from behind the couch.
meanings.sent2: I popped into the store for a quick errand.
meanings.sent3: The surprise party popped up out of nowhere.
meanings.sent4: The idea popped into my head like magic.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel popped across the yard in a flash.

meanings.definition: To put or thrust quickly or suddenly.
meanings.sent1: She popped the coin into the vending machine.
meanings.sent2: I popped the letter into the mailbox.
meanings.sent3: He popped the question during dinner.
meanings.sent4: The key popped into the lock effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The cork popped out of the bottle with a pop.

meanings.sent1: A new idea popped into my mind.
meanings.sent2: The answer popped up on the screen.
meanings.sent3: The opportunity popped out of the blue.
meanings.sent4: Her name popped into my head out of nowhere.
meanings.sent5: The solution popped up when least expected.

meanings.sent1: The balloon popped when it touched the cactus.
meanings.sent3: The dam popped under the force of the water.
meanings.sent4: The tire popped on the sharp rock.
meanings.sent5: The piñata popped open with a shower of candies.
